etymology.description: 充(充) (chōng, "to charge"), 值(值) (zhí, "value"), 卡(卡) (kǎ, "card")
etymology.interpretation: 充值卡(充值卡) (chōngzhíkǎ, "recharge card") combines 充(充) (chōng, "to charge") and 值(值) (zhí, "value") to indicate the action of adding value, along with 卡(卡) (kǎ, "card"), representing a card. Therefore, a 充值卡 is a card that is used to recharge or add value to an account, such as for mobile phones or prepaid services.

parts.english: to charge; to fill; to act in place of; sufficient
value; worth; to be worth; to deserve

examples.chinese: 我昨天买了一张充值卡(我昨天買了一張充值卡)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zuótiān mǎile yī zhāng chōngzhíkǎ.
examples.english: I bought a recharge card yesterday.

examples.chinese: 手机流量用完时(手機流量用完時)，充值卡可以让我继续上网(充值卡可以讓我繼續上網)。
examples.pinyin: Shǒujī liúliàng yòng wán shí, chōngzhíkǎ kěyǐ ràng wǒ jìxù shàngwǎng.
examples.english: When my phone's data runs out, a recharge card lets me continue to go online.

examples.chinese: 他不明白充值卡的使用方法(他不明白充值卡的使用方法)。
examples.pinyin: Tā bù míngbái chōngzhíkǎ de shǐyòng fāngfǎ.
examples.english: He doesn't understand how to use the recharge card.
